greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest integer m such that Sum_{k=1..m} prime(k) is divisible by n.
comment: It follows from a theorem of Daniel Shiu that m always exists. See A111287 for details. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 05 2005
reference: Felice Russo, A set of new Smarandache functions, sequences and conjectures in number theory, American Research Press 2000
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000 (first 1000 terms from T. D. Noe)
D. K. L. Shiu, Strings of Congruent Primes, J. Lond. Math. Soc. 61 (2) (2000) 359-373 [MR1760689]
maple: read transforms; M:=1000; p0:=[seq(ithprime(i),i=1..M)]; q0:=PSUM(p0); w:=[]; for n from 1 to M do p:=n; hit := 0; for i from 1 to M do if q0[i] mod p = 0 then w:=[op(w),i]; hit:=1; break; fi; od: if hit = 0 then break; fi; od: w;
program: a053050 n = head [k | (k, x) <- zip [1..] a007504_list, mod x n == 0]
results.author: _Felice Russo_, Feb 25 2000
ext: More terms from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 05 2005
